title: Biomarker Manual
text:
The place to find example code and recommendations for biomarkers by indication.
Use the search bar to type in a biomarker name or variant. Or, browse the side navigation by indication.

title: About
text:
Biomarker recommendations will be updated quarterly. Each page will indicate whether the code has been updated for the current quarter’s data release.
Biomarker recommendations are based on what has been confirmed by looking in EMOL patient records, and inconsistencies that may be present. The goal is to be as thorough as possible, but if you see something that needs to be changed, please let me know. [link to email or jira]
If you do not see the biomarker or variant that you need, it may be in progress. However, just in case, submit your biomarker, variant, and indication here. [link to email or jira]
** Of Note**:  - When pulling biomarker records from GN360, it may be necessary to query both genetic_test and patient_test tables. We found that in some cases, for some genes/biomarkers, there are patients listed in patient_test that are not in genetic_test. Because of this, please remember to check both tables, and add results from patient_test to genetic_test when necessary. Code in this manual adds patients from both tables when applicable. - In general, if you see that some records are marked as “Suppressed” it is best to exclude them from your counts, especially if the goal is to find number of positive tests for a particular biomarker.
Abbreviations  - AA: amino acid  - CDS: coding sequence  - TKIs: Tyrosine kinase inhibitors - IHC: Immunohistochemistry

title: EGFR E709
text:
Code updated for Q4 2022
This variant, located on exon 18, is a single nucleotide missense mutation changing Glutamic Acid (Glu) to another amino acid, commonly to Aspartic Acid (Asp).
This is not as common of a mutation as others like L858R and G719X, so numbers of patients with detected/positive results are going to be low.
See ClinVar for more information.
AA mutation: p.E709A, p.E709K, p.E709V, p.E709Q, p.E709D, p.E709G  CDS mutation: c.2127A>C, c.2125G>A, c.2126A>T, c.2126A>G, c.2126A>C, other others

title: EGFR E709
text:
Example code: PT360
select chai_patient_id,
       test_name_name,
       test_date,
       test_collection_date,
       genetic_test_type_name,
       test_method_name,
       molecular_variant_name,
       test_value_name

from c3_pt360_202212_nsclc.patient_test
where test_name_name ilike '%EGFR%' and
      molecular_variant_name similar to '%(E709|e709|codons 709)%' and
      test_value_name = 'Positive';

title: EGFR E709
text:
Example code: GN360
select chai_patient_id,
       test_name_name,
       test_date,
       genetic_test_type_name,
       test_method_name,
       molecular_variant_name,
       'p.E709X' as protein_alteration,
       test_value_name
from c3_gn360_202212_nsclc.patient_test
    where test_name_name like '%EGFR%' and molecular_variant_name similar to '%(E709|e709|codons 709)%'
    and test_value_name = 'Positive'


UNION

select chai_patient_id,
       biomarker_name as test_name_name,
       report_date as test_date,
       biomarker_test_type as genetic_test_type_name,
       'NGS or PCR' as test_method_name,
       dna_alteration as molecular_variant_name,
       protein_alteration,
       test_result as test_value_name
from c3_gn360_202212_nsclc.genetic_test
where biomarker_name = 'EGFR' and protein_alteration like 'p.E709%' and
test_value_name = 'Positive'

title: EGFR E709 variant
text:
Notes on Results

In the results, there are some records that come up with molecular_variant_name (PT360) or dna_alteration (GN360) as c.2127_2129delAAC and protein_alteration as p.E709_T710>D or p.E709T710delinsD. You may want to check with your client or consider if this would be acceptable. Luckily, as of Q4 2022, there are only 3 records with these results, so it won’t decrease counts much.

title: EGFR G719X
text:
Code updated for Q4 2022
This variant, located on exon 18, is a single nucleotide missense mutation changing Glycine (Gly) to another amino acid, commonly to Alanine (Ala).
See ClinVar for more information.
AA mutation: p.G719X (X could be D, A, R, S, C, or possibly others)  CDS mutation: c.2155G>A, c.2155G>C, c.2155G>T, c.2156G>A, c.2156G>C

title: EGFR G719X
text:
Example Code: PT360
select chai_patient_id,
       test_name_name,
       test_date,
       test_collection_date,
       genetic_test_type_name,
       test_method_name,
       molecular_variant_name,
       test_value_name,
       curation_indicator
       from c3_pt360_202212_nsclc.patient_test
    where test_name_name like '%EGFR%' AND
          molecular_variant_name similar to '%(G719|Gly719|c.215_G)%' and
          molecular_variant_name <> 'G7195 8709 a' and
          test_method_name not in ('Immunohistochemistry or immunocytochemistry, per specimen; initial single antibody stain procedure',
                                  'Molecular cytogenetics; DNA probe, each (eg, FISH)') and
          lower(genetic_test_type_name) not similar to '%(amp|del)%' and 
          test_value_name = 'Positive';

title: EGFR G719X
text:
Example Code: GN360
select chai_patient_id,
       test_name_name,
       test_date,
       genetic_test_type_name,
       test_method_name,
       molecular_variant_name,
       'p.G719X' as protein_alteration,
       test_value_name

from c3_gn360_202212_nsclc.patient_test

where test_name_name like '%EGFR%' and
      molecular_variant_name similar to '%(G719|Gly719|c.215_G)%' and
          molecular_variant_name <> 'G7195 8709 a' and
          test_method_name not in ('Immunohistochemistry or immunocytochemistry, per specimen; initial single antibody stain procedure',
                                  'Molecular cytogenetics; DNA probe, each (eg, FISH)') and
      lower(genetic_test_type_name) not similar to '%(amp|del)%'
      and test_value_name = 'Positive'

UNION

select chai_patient_id,
       biomarker_name as test_name_name,
       report_date as test_date,
       biomarker_test_type as genetic_test_type_name,
       'NGS' as test_method_name,
       dna_alteration as molecular_variant_name,
       protein_alteration,
       test_result as test_value_name
from c3_gn360_202212_nsclc.genetic_test
where biomarker_name = 'EGFR' AND
          protein_alteration similar to '%G719%'and
          test_value_name = 'Positive';

title: EGFR G719X
text:
Notes and Recommendations

Notice that IHC and FISH are being removed as test methods. There is some evidence that there are ways to identify some variants of EGFR via IHC, but after checking the patient records that have these methods listed, it was actually found that the test method should be listed as PCR or NGS. The patient(s) marked as having FISH as a method is also incorrect.
Note that genetic test types similar to '%(amp|del)%' are being removed. This is removing Gene amplification and Gene deletion. These are inaccurate since this is a missense mutation.

title: EGFR E709
text:
Notes and Recommendations

In the results, there are some records that come up with molecular_variant_name (PT360) or dna_alteration (GN360) as c.2127_2129delAAC and protein_alteration as p.E709_T710>D or p.E709T710delinsD. You may want to check with your client or consider if this would be acceptable. Luckily, as of Q4 2022, there are only 3 records with these results, so it won’t decrease counts much.

title: EGFR L858R
text:
Code updated for Q4 2022
L858R usually refers to a missense point mutation located on exon 21. However, keep in mind that there are an inversion and indel that are also labeled as p.Leu858Arg, but AA mutation notation is c.2572_2573inv, and c.2573_2574delinsGT, respectively.
See ClinVar for more information
AA mutation: p.L858R, p.Leu858Arg  CDS mutation: c.2573T>G, c.2572_2573inv, c.2573_2574delinsGT

title: EGFR L858R
text:
Example Code: PT360
select chai_patient_id,
       test_name_name,
       test_date,
       test_collection_date,
       genetic_test_type_name,
       test_method_name,
       molecular_variant_name,
       test_value_name,
       curation_indicator
from c3_pt360_202212_nsclc.patient_test
where test_name_name ilike '%EGFR%'
    and lower(molecular_variant_name_clean) similar to
           '%(l858r|l85r|2573t>g|2573t&g|2573t.g|t2573g|2573_2574deltginsgt|2572_2573del|2572_2573ct>a|2572-2573ct>ag|leu858arg)%' and
    genetic_test_type_name not in ('Genomic structural variant copy number','Gene amplification') and
    test_method_name not similar to '%ish%|%in situ%';

title: EGFR L858R
text:
Example Code: GN360
select chai_patient_id,
       test_name_name,
       test_date,
       genetic_test_type_name,
       test_method_name,
       molecular_variant_name,
       'p.L858R' as protein_alteration,
       replace(molecular_variant_name, ' ', '') as molecular_variant_name_clean,
       test_value_name
from c3_gn360_202212_nsclc.patient_test
where test_name_name ilike '%EGFR%'
    and lower(molecular_variant_name_clean) similar to
           '%(l858r|l85r|2573t>g|2573t&g|2573t.g|t2573g|2573_2574deltginsgt|2572_2573del|2572_2573ct>a|2572-2573ct>ag|leu858arg)%' and
    genetic_test_type_name not in ('Genomic structural variant copy number','Gene amplification') and
    test_method_name not similar to '%ish%|%in situ%'

UNION

select chai_patient_id,
       biomarker_name as test_name_name,
       report_date as test_date,
       biomarker_test_type as genetic_test_type_name,
       'NGS' as test_method_name,
       dna_alteration as molecular_variant_name,
       protein_alteration,
       test_result as test_value_name
from c3_gn360_202212_nsclc.genetic_test
where biomarker_name = 'EGFR' and protein_alteration = 'p.L858R';

title: EGFR del19
text:
Code updated for Q4 2022
Deletion in exon 19 can be a deletion in different locations on exon 19 of EGFR. Because of this, it can be complicated to capture all of the diversity of annotations in the data.
Common AA mutation (among others): p.E746_A750del, p.L747-A750>P, p.L747_S752del  Common CDS mutation (among others): c.2235_2249del, c.2239_2251del

title: EGFR del19
text:
Example Code: PT360
select chai_patient_id,
       test_name_name,
       test_date,
       test_collection_date,
       genetic_test_type_name,
       test_method_name,
       molecular_variant_name,
       replace(molecular_variant_name, ' ', '') as molecular_variant_name_clean,
       test_value_name

from c3_pt360_202212_nsclc.patient_test
where test_name_name ilike '%EGFR%'
  and (lower(molecular_variant_name) similar to '%(del%ex%19|ex%19%del|exon deletion 19|e746_a750|c.2236_2250delgaattaagag aagca (p.glu746_ala750del)| ' ||
                                                'p.l74l_s752del|exon 19 e746_a750|p.glu746_ala750del|del19 (p.e746_a650del)|del 19|c.2235_2249del|' ||
                                                'del%e746_a750|l747_a750>p|exon 19 p.e746_a750|e746_a750delinsv|del%19|e746_1750del|l747_p753‚àö√â¬¨√á‚àö√á¬¨¬™S|' ||
                                                'exon 19 l747_t51|746-a750|l747_t751del|e746 a750del|p.l747_p753delinss (c.2240_2257del18)|' ||
                                                'e746_r748del|e746-a750|exon 19 glu746-ala750|exon 19 c2236_2250 del|e746_a750%del|c.2235-2249del15|exon 19, l747_a750|' ||
                                                'p. l747_s752|e746-a750 del|exon 19 e746-a750|e746-a750del|p.l747_pro753delinss|del%e746_a750|s752_i759del|p.glu746_ala750del|' ||
                                                'exon 19 p.e746-s752|exon 19 p.e746_a750delelrea (c.2235_2249del15)|l747_a750>p|leu747-a1a750|exon 19 pE746_A750|c.2240_2257del|' ||
                                                'e746_l747%del|l747_t751del|c.2235_2249del|l747-a750 del|e746_l747>1p|l747_a750del/insp|p.l747_p753del lrearsp>s|' ||
                                                'p.glu746-ala750|p.e746_a70|c.2239_2248delinsc(p.l747_a750delinsp|c.2235_2249del (p. e746_a759del)|e748-a750del|glu746-ala750 deletion|' ||
                                                'glu746_ala750del|p.747-T751delins|p.glu746-ala750|c.2236_2250del|glu 746_ala750|p.l747_p753del|glu746_ser752delins|e746_a750del|' ||
                                                'glu746-ala 750|glu 746-ala 750 deletion|c.2240_2254del(p.l747_t751 del)|exon 19 ae 746-a750|e19del|exon 19%l747_t751|e19del|' ||
                                                'c.2235_2249del;2250a>g p.delglu746_ala750|exon 19, l747_t751del|exon 19 deletion (p.leu747_ala750delinspro)|e746_a750del5|' ||
                                                'c.2239_2251delinsc;p.l74-t751delinsp|exon 19 - c.2236_2250|p.l747_t751del|p.e746-t751 del/ins|L747_P753delins|2235-2249del(p.e750del)|' ||
                                                'e19glu746-ala750 deletion|p.e746_t751>a or p.e746_s752>a exon 19|exon 19 p. e746 a750|p.e746_t751delinsa|c.2239_2256deliostca(p.l747_t751del)|' ||
                                                'l747_a750delinsp;2239_2248delinsc|c.2235-2249del (p.e746-2750del)|c.2235_2249del15|c.2236_2250del;p.e746_a750d|exon 19 p.l747_a750|' ||
                                                'exon 19; e746-a750|e746-a750|p.l747-p753|exon18-p.e746_t751|p.glu746_ala750del|glu_746_ala750del|e756_a750del5|p.l747_a755del/ins|' ||
                                                'p.l747_t751|c.2236_2244delgaattga|c.2235-2249del))%'
    and genetic_test_type_name not in ('Genomic structural variant copy number','Not Recorded''Gene rearrangement','Gene amplification','Genomic Structural Variation') and
        lower(test_method_name) not similar to '%ish%|%in situ%') or
    (lower(genetic_test_type_name) in ('gene deletion', 'deletion mutation')
                and (lower(molecular_variant_name) similar to '%(ex%19|l747_t751|e746_a750|l747 exon 19|e746_t751|p.l747_t751|lrea 747-750 exon 19|exon 19,S752_I759)%'
                     or molecular_variant_name = '19'));

title: EGFR del19
text:
Example Code: GN360
select chai_patient_id,
       test_result,
       dna_alteration,
       protein_alteration
from c3_gn360_202212_nsclc.genetic_test
where biomarker_name = 'EGFR' and variant_grouping ='EGFR exon 19 deletion';

title: EGFR T790M
text:
Code updated for Q4 2022
T790M is a missense point mutation located on exon 20. This mutation is regarded as the most common cause of resistance to TKIs.
See ClinVar for more information.
AA mutation: p.T790M, p.Thr790Met CDS mutation: c.2368C>T

title: EGFR T790M
text:
Example Code: PT360
select chai_patient_id,
       test_name_name,
       test_date,
       test_collection_date,
       genetic_test_type_name,
       test_method_name,
       molecular_variant_name,
       test_value_name,
       curation_indicator
from c3_pt360_202212_nsclc.patient_test
where test_name_name ilike '%EGFR%'
  and ((molecular_variant_name ilike '%exon%20%' and molecular_variant_name ilike '%790%')
           or lower(molecular_variant_name_clean) similar to '%(thr790met|t790m|2369c>t)%')
  and molecular_variant_name not in ('E790K', 'p.T790L', 'exon 19 positive (negative T790M', 'exon 19 mutation, negative T790M', 'p.T790A')
  and genetic_test_type_name not in ('Small InDel','Genomic structural variant copy number','Gene deletion','Gene rearrangement','Protein Expression')
  and lower(test_method_name) not similar to '%ish%|%in situ%|%immuno%|not recorded';

title: EGFR T790M
text:
Example Code: GN360
select chai_patient_id,
       test_name_name,
       test_date,
       genetic_test_type_name,
       test_method_name,
       molecular_variant_name,
       'p.T790M' as protein_alteration,
       test_value_name

from c3_gn360_202212_nsclc.patient_test
where test_name_name ilike '%EGFR%'
  and ((molecular_variant_name ilike '%exon%20%' and molecular_variant_name ilike '%790%')
           or lower(molecular_variant_name_clean) similar to '%(thr790met|t790m|2369c>t)%')
  and molecular_variant_name not in ('E790K', 'p.T790L', 'exon 19 positive (negative T790M', 'exon 19 mutation, negative T790M', 'p.T790A')
  and genetic_test_type_name not in ('Small InDel','Genomic structural variant copy number','Gene deletion','Gene rearrangement','Protein Expression')
  and lower(test_method_name) not similar to '%ish%|%in situ%|%immuno%|not recorded'

UNION

select chai_patient_id,
       biomarker_name as test_name_name,
       report_date as test_date,
       biomarker_test_type as genetic_test_type_name,
       'NGS' as test_method_name,
       dna_alteration as molecular_variant_name,
       protein_alteration,
       test_result as test_value_name

from c3_gn360_202212_nsclc.genetic_test
where biomarker_name = 'EGFR' and protein_alteration = 'p.T790M';

title: EGFR S768I
text:
Code updated for Q4 2022
S768I is a mutation that is not one of the top most common mutations in EGFR, so numbers could be fairly low in comparison to others like L858R or exon 19 deletion. It is a missense mutation on exon 20, but also shares the same AA notation as an indel on exon 20, c.2303_2304delinsTT.
See ClinVar for more information.
AA mutation: p.S768I, p.Ser768Ile  CDS mutation: c.2303G>T, c.2303_2304delinsTT

title: EGFR S768I
text:
Example Code: PT360
select chai_patient_id,
       test_name_name,
       test_date,
       test_collection_date,
       genetic_test_type_name,
       test_method_name,
       molecular_variant_name,
       test_value_name,
       curation_indicator
       from c3_pt360_202212_nsclc.patient_test
    where test_name_name like '%EGFR%' AND
          molecular_variant_name similar to '%(S768I|2303G[:>]T)%|%S768' and
          test_method_name not in ('Immunohistochemistry or immunocytochemistry, per specimen; initial single antibody stain procedure',
                                  'Molecular cytogenetics; DNA probe, each (eg, FISH)') ;

title: EGFR S768I
text:
Example Code: GN360
select chai_patient_id,
       test_name_name,
       test_date,
       genetic_test_type_name,
       test_method_name,
       molecular_variant_name,
       'p.S768I' as protein_alteration,
       test_value_name

from c3_gn360_202212_nsclc.patient_test
    where test_name_name like '%EGFR%' AND
          molecular_variant_name similar to '%(S768I|2303G[:>]T)%|%S768' and
          test_method_name not in ('Immunohistochemistry or immunocytochemistry, per specimen; initial single antibody stain procedure',
                                  'Molecular cytogenetics; DNA probe, each (eg, FISH)')

UNION

select chai_patient_id,
       biomarker_name as test_name_name,
       report_date as test_date,
       biomarker_test_type as genetic_test_type_name,
       'NGS' as test_method_name,
       dna_alteration as molecular_variant_name,
       protein_alteration,
       test_result as test_value_name
from c3_gn360_202212_nsclc.genetic_test
where biomarker_name = 'EGFR' and
      protein_alteration similar to '%(S768I)%';

title: EGFR S768I
text:
Notes and Recommendations

Note that IHC and FISH are note valid testing methods for this particular mutation

title: EGFR Exon 20 insertions
text:
Code updated for Q4 2022
Exon 20 insertions is another one of those mutation types that is not as straight forward as you may think since the insertion can occur in multiple possible places along exon 20.

title: EGFR Exon 20 insertions
text:
Example Code: PT360
SELECT chai_patient_id,
       test_name_name,
       test_date,
       test_collection_date,
       genetic_test_type_name,
       test_method_name,
       molecular_variant_name,
       test_value_name,
       curation_indicator
from c3_pt360_202212_nsclc.patient_test
where test_name_name similar to 'EGFR%'
and (lower(molecular_variant_name) similar to lower ('%(76[1-9][_-]|77[0-5][_-]|V769 D770insASV|exon 20 insertion|exon 20 insertion|EXON 20 Insertion|' ||
                                                     'N771delinsTH|2310-2311 ins GGT|2310_2311insGGT|2311_2312ins8GCGTGGACA|2307-2308 ins GCCAGCGTG|' ||
                                                     '2307_2308ins9GCCAGCGTG|2307-2308 ins OCCAGCGTG|2307_2308ins9|H773DELINSPHPN|exon 20  8 bp ins|' ||
                                                     '20Ins 9|20Ins9|20 Ins9|exon 20 ins|e20ins|EXON 20 INS|exon 20  12 bp ins|Exon 20 12 bp ins|' ||
                                                     'exon 20  3 bp ins|Exon 20 3 bp ins|2317delinsTACT|exon 20c[.]2312_2313insACAC|exon 20  6 bp ins|' ||
                                                     'Exon 20 6 bp ins|Exon 20 8 bp ins|A775 G776insYVMA exon 20|H773delinsYY|H773 V774insH ex 20|' ||
                                                     '2319_2320insCAC|2319-2320 ins CAC|2319 2320insCAC|2319-2320 ins CAC|H773delinsYPNPY|H773dup|' ||
                                                     'D770delinsGY|D770delinsGY|2308_2309insGTT|2311_2312delinsGGGTT|N771delinsGF|N771>PH|V769 D770insASV|' ||
                                                     'D770>GY|N771_H773>HHPH|N771>KG|N771_P772>SVDNA|H773>YNPY|2284-5_2290dup)%'))
and molecular_variant_name not in ('c.2303GCG>TCT, p.S768_V769L','c.2303_2305delinsTCT, p.S768_V769delinsIL','p.D770_N771delinsGY');

title: EGFR Exon 20 insertions
text:
Example Code: GN360
select chai_patient_id,
       test_value_name
from patient_test
where test_name_name similar to 'EGFR%'
     and (lower(molecular_variant_name) similar to
          lower('%(76[1-9][_-]|77[0-5][_-]|V769 D770insASV|exon 20 insertion|exon 20 insertion|EXON 20 Insertion|' ||
                          'N771delinsTH|2310-2311 ins GGT|2310_2311insGGT|2311_2312ins8GCGTGGACA|2307-2308 ins GCCAGCGTG|' ||
                          '2307_2308ins9GCCAGCGTG|2307-2308 ins OCCAGCGTG|2307_2308ins9|H773DELINSPHPN|exon 20  8 bp ins|' ||
                          '20Ins 9|20Ins9|20 Ins9|exon 20 ins|e20ins|EXON 20 INS|exon 20  12 bp ins|' ||
                          'Exon 20 12 bp ins|exon 20  3 bp ins|Exon 20 3 bp ins|2317delinsTACT|exon 20c[.]2312_2313insACAC|' ||
                          'exon 20  6 bp ins|Exon 20 6 bp ins|Exon 20 8 bp ins|A775 G776insYVMA exon 20|H773delinsYY|' ||
                          'H773 V774insH ex 20|2319_2320insCAC|2319-2320 ins CAC|2319 2320insCAC|2319-2320 ins CAC|' ||
                          'H773delinsYPNPY|H773dup|D770delinsGY|D770delinsGY|2308_2309insGTT|2311_2312delinsGGGTT|N771delinsGF|' ||
                          'N771>PH|V769 D770insASV|D770>GY|N771_H773>HHPH|N771>KG|N771_P772>SVDNA|H773>YNPY|2284-5_2290dup)%'))
       and molecular_variant_name not in
                   ('c.2303GCG>TCT, p.S768_V769L', 'c.2303_2305delinsTCT, p.S768_V769delinsIL', 'p.D770_N771delinsGY')

UNION

select chai_patient_id,
       test_result as test_value_name
from genetic_test
where biomarker_name ilike '%EGFR%'
      and variant_grouping = 'EGFR Exon 20 Insertion Mutation'
      and test_result ilike '%positive%'
      and (protein_alteration not in ('p.C797S', 'p.D770_N771delinsGY', 'p.S768_V769L', 'p.S768_V769delinsIL') or protein_alteration is null)

title: EGFR Exon 20 insertions
text:
Notes and Recommendations
Although S768I is located on exon 20 and can be an indel, thus is technically an exon 20 insertion, these are removed to distinguish the two mutation categories. You may want to consult with your client to see if they would prefer to keep them separated as distinct mutations, or if it is okay to keep them lumped together as one category

title: EGFR L861Q
text:
Code updated for Q4 2022
A less common point mutation in EGFR that changes Leucine to Glutamine, that is pretty simple and straight forward to pull from the data.
See ClinVar for more information.
AA mutation: p.L861Q, p.Leu861Gln  CDS mutation: c.2582T>A

title: EGFR L861Q
text:
Example Code: PT360
select chai_patient_id,
       test_name_name,
       test_date,
       test_collection_date,
       genetic_test_type_name,
       test_method_name,
       molecular_variant_name,
       test_value_name,
       curation_indicator
       from c3_pt360_202212_nsclc.patient_test
    where test_name_name like '%EGFR%' and
          molecular_variant_name similar to '%(L861Q|258_T[:>]A)%|%L861' and
          test_method_name not similar to '%(FISH|in situ|immuno)%' and genetic_test_type_name <> 'Gene deletion';

title: EGFR L861Q
text:
Example Code: GN360
select chai_patient_id,
       test_name_name,
       test_date,
       genetic_test_type_name,
       test_method_name,
       molecular_variant_name,
       'p.L861Q' as protein_alteration,
       test_value_name

from c3_gn360_202212_nsclc.patient_test
    where test_name_name like '%EGFR%' AND
          molecular_variant_name similar to '%(L861Q|2582T[:>]A)%|%L861' and
          test_method_name not similar to '%(FISH|in situ|immuno)%' and 
          genetic_test_type_name <> 'Gene deletion'

UNION

select chai_patient_id,
       biomarker_name as test_name_name,
       report_date as test_date,
       biomarker_test_type as genetic_test_type_name,
       'NGS' as test_method_name,
       dna_alteration as molecular_variant_name,
       protein_alteration,
       test_result as test_value_name
from c3_gn360_202212_nsclc.genetic_test
where biomarker_name = 'EGFR' and
      protein_alteration similar to '%L861Q%|%L861';

title: BRCA
text:
Code updated for Q4 2022
BRCA1 and BRCA2 are commonly mutated in breast cancer and ovarian cancer. This is commonly queried for by clients. BRCA1/2 can have many different mutations so when querying for BRCA1/2 mutations or status is querying for all mutations possible, including point mutations, deletions, duplications, etc.

title: BRCA
text:
Example Code: PT360
SELECT chai_patient_id,
    test_name_name,
    test_date,
    test_method_name,
    molecular_variant_name,
    genetic_test_type_name,
    test_value_name
FROM patient_test
WHERE test_date IS NOT NULL AND
      test_name_name ILIKE '%brca%'
    AND (LOWER(test_method_name) NOT SIMILAR TO '%(immun|profiling by real-time|suppressed)%'
        OR LOWER(genetic_test_type_name) NOT SIMILAR TO '%(protein expression|index|suppressed)%');

title: BRCA
text:
